definitions.definition: To render dull; to remove or blunt an edge or something that was sharp.
examples: Years of misuse have dulled the tools.

definitions.definition: To soften, moderate or blunt ; to make dull, stupid, or sluggish; to stupefy .
examples: He drinks to dull the pain.

definitions.definition: To lose a sharp edge; to become dull.
examples: A razor will dull with use.

definitions.definition: To render dim or obscure; to sully; to tarnish.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To render dull; to remove or blunt an edge or something that was sharp.
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To soften, moderate or blunt ; to make dull, stupid, or sluggish; to stupefy .
( intransitive ) To lose a sharp edge; to become dull.
To render dim or obscure; to sully; to tarnish.
